channel.title: Knn on Yet Another Iteration
channel.description: Recent content in Knn on Yet Another Iteration

item.title: kNN Analysis on MNIST with 97% accuracy
item.description: Usually Yann LeCun’s MNIST database is used to explore Artificial Neural Network architectures for image recognition problem. In the last post the use of a ANN (LeNet architecture) implemented using mxnet to resolve this classification problem. But in this post, we’ll see that the MNIST problem isn’t a difficult one, only resolved by ANNs, analyzing the data set we can see that is possible, with a high degree of precision, resolving this classification problem with a simple k-nearest neighbors algorithm.
